t: Buzzard’s Roost: Up To the Challenge — The ABV Network
s: May 6, 2020 - Jason Brauner readily admits that he was never a big fan of rye. “I didn’t find rye to be sippable like Bourbon is”, Jason said. “Of course, I carry rye in the restaurant so I make it a point to know a lot about it. I was just not much of a fan of it”. When Jason foun

t: Buzzards Roost Whiskey
s: Buzzard's Roost Whiskeys stand out for exceptional flavors created using a break-through combination of techniques for second barrel aging. Buzzard’s Roost uses 18-month-seasoned oak barrels with a Char #1 over intentional levels of toast to coax out the most delicious flavors.

t: Buzzards roost: Amazon.co.uk: Dennard, Tom: 9780965613804: Books
s: Born in Pineview, Georgia. Attended Davidson College in N.C. Graduate of University of Georgia Law School. Practices law in Brunswick, Georgia. Created the Hostel in the Forest. Published four books: Discovering Life's Trails, Buzzards Roost, Born a Ramblin' Man, and Letters to Henry.

t: In-Depth Review: Buzzard’s Roost Char #1 Straight Bourbon Whiskey
s: April 2, 2023 - Both in and out of the restaurant, Jason remained a fierce advocate of the spirit he loves so much. So much so, the he ended up co-founding Buzzard’s Roost in 2019, a brand which sources and re-barreles rye! The original intention was to distill bourbon, which fell through due to lack of funding.
